Policy Owner: Administration of the National Distribution Center falls under the direction of the Commissioner, Wage and Investment (W&I).

Acronym Deﬁnition CAPS Computer Assisted Publishing System COTS Commercial-off-the-shelf DMS Distribution Management System ELITE Enterprise Logistics Information Technology ESN Electronic Status Notice EWCS ELITE Warehouse Control System FMS Forecasting Management System IMDDS Internal Management Document Distribution System M&P Media and Publication NDC National Distribution Center OMS Order Management Systemr OSMS Order Subscription Management Systems TAC Tax Assistance Center TFOP Tax Assistance Center TPDS Training Publication Distribution System VITA Volunteer Income Tax Assistance W&I Wage and Investment WMS Warehouse Management System

) The NDC provides order fulﬁllment services and distribution of products to internal and external customers. The distribution center uses two software systems for operations: • Enterprise Logistics Information Technology (ELITE) • Computer Assisted Publishing System (CAPS) (

) ELITE maintains NDC inventory, controls orders, manages account tion, and provides warehouse management tools. ELITE also generates picking tickets that NDC staff uses to ﬁll orders. ELITE is a shelf (COTS) application that includes the following modules: • Order Management System (OMS) • Warehouse Management System (WMS) • Distribution Management System (DMS) • ELITE Reporting Facility • Forecasting Management System (FMS) • Resource Management System • ELITE Warehouse Control System (EWCS) • Transportation Management System (TMS) (

) The CAPS maintains product speciﬁcation information. NDC staff enters for several specialty programs in CAPS and downloads them into ELITE. Order Subscription Management System (OSMS) is an online ordering for internal orders that operates with the CAPS. (

) The Processing Section at the NDC receives public and internal requests IRS products. Customers may order by phone, or mail and through the IRS intranet and Internet websites. • Phone number for internal orders:
• Phone number for external orders:
• efax number for internal orders:
• Website for internal orders: hom
age.xhtml • Website for external orders: http://www.irs.gov/forms-instructions (
) Processing clerks respond to telephone messages from internal customers who place orders or request information about the status of products and orders. (

) Some products and quantities are restricted to particular customers or customer groups. ELITE ﬂags orders that exceed the quantity limits and system generates a daily report of those orders. Analysts review the report each day and decide whether to override the limitations or reject the order. (
) The quantity limitations for tax products by customer are set in Electronic Status Notice (ESN) and can change: n individual ordering tax related materials.

Order Management System (OMS) Warehouse Management System (WMS) Distribution Management System (DMS) ELITE Reporting Facility Forecasting Management System (FMS) Resource Management System ELITE Warehouse Control System Transportation Management System

Center 1.18.5 page 3 Order Type Description Bank A ﬁnancial institution ordering products to meet its tax reporting requirements Employer A business ordering products to meet its tax- reporting requirements. Library 1. A public library acting as a third-party dis- tributor of tax materials, usually as part of TFOP. 2. A library ordering products to meet its tax reporting requirements. Other Govern- 1. A federal, state, or local government or ment Agencies government-affiliated organization (such as schools, universities and military installations) acting as third party distributor of tax materials to the public or their employees. 2. A federal, state, or local government or government-affiliated organization (such as schools, universities and military installations) ordering products to meet its tax reporting requirements. Post Office 1. A post office acting as a third party distributor of tax materials, usually as part of the Tax Forms Outlet Program (TFOP). 2. A post office ordering products to meet its tax reporting requirements. Taxpayer An individual ordering tax related materials. Tax Professional 1. A person or ﬁrm that prepares tax returns for compensation. 2. A person or ﬁrm that prepares tax returns for compensation and is ordering products to meet its tax reporting requirements.
A person or ﬁrm that prepares tax returns for compensation. A person or ﬁrm that prepares tax returns for compensation and is ordering products to meet its tax reporting requirements.
NDC processing clerks open and sort incoming mail. The clerks forward rected mail and remittances to their correct destination.
The IRS has various methods of making tax forms and instructions available to the public. Processing clerks ﬁll orders for the programs listed below.
The terms “order type” and “programs” are interchangeable. An order type/ program indicates who is placing the order.

Programs Users International Program Supplies American embassies with tax forms to meet the needs of Americans overseas Internal Management Document Manages and distributes internal Distribution System (IMDDS) documents to IRS personnel Program Tax Forms Outlets Program Supplies post offices, libraries, (TFOP) and other outlets with tax materials for distribution to the public Prior Year Program Supplies public and internal customers with tax products from previous years Internal Program Provides IRS employees with forms and publications Taxpayer Assistance Center Supplies Taxpayer Assistance (TAC) Centers with products for distribu- tion to the public Volunteer Income Tax Assistance Supplies customers with tax (VITA) Program forms, instructions and publica- tions

page 5 Programs Users Employer Program Supplies businesses with employ- ment tax products for employee and company use Small Business Program Supplies forms and publications for small business workshops and/or educate clients on federal tax obligations Package Assembly Program Supplies packages of tax products for conferences and trade shows administered by IRS employees
A picking ticket lists the products to ﬁll an order. It includes:
The clerk must check the work station and verify that it is stocked with the correct products and product revisions before ﬁlling orders.

To complete an order, the clerk must check to verify that all products are included in the correct container, that quantity included is accurate, that the stock is in good condition, and that the customer’s address is visible on the
After completing an order, the clerk places the container on the appropriate conveyor for transportation to the veriﬁcation scales.
) Sometimes the IRS includes in an order items the customer did not request. Examples include information about products in a shipment, such as errata notices and Form
, Action On Your Tax Forms Order. (
) The IRS issues errata notices when printed products contain errors or late islation minimally changes the content of the material. The IRS reprints products that contain critical errors. (
) Form
informs the customer about changes in the order. (
) An internal order is a request for IRS products from an IRS employee. (

) NDC clerks ﬁll orders for most internal use products from a stock carousel. The carousel is a storage and retrieval device consisting of a series of bins mounted on an oval track. When the carousel is activated, the bins to bring the required items to the operator. The operator places the product into a tub. After completing the order, the operator pushes the tub onto a conveyor that takes it to a packing station. (
) ELITE uses demand and minimum level parameters to replenish fulﬁllment stock. (
) Line resupply impacts productivity, quality, turnaround times, and safety. (

) NDC Transportation Staff: a. Provides information for shipping orders at the Distribution Center, updates ELITE transportation tables, and maintains a system of ability for outgoing shipments b. Provides guidance to NDC employees for determining and obtaining and transportation services so that materials arrive at destinations and efficiently using the most cost effective method c. Works with the Postal and Transport Policy section in M&P Distribution Requirements branch to ensure that policies, standards, niques, and procedures are followed when shipping printed materials d. Acts as the NDC’s mail Pre-sort contracting officer’s representative (COR) Point of Contact (POC) (

) Logistics personnel: a. Follow inventory management practices b. Maintain inventory accuracy and reorder points c. Receive inbound product shipments and inspect them for damage d. Transport stock from the receiving dock to warehousing locations e. Pull stock from warehouse locations for Order Processing use f. Replenish stock g. Fill bulk orders h. Load outbound trucks (

Distribution Center
) Throughout the year, NDC employees must dispose of obsolete, revised, damaged, or unusable products. NDC employees identify and dispose of products as directed by designated M&P analysts. (

) The NDC maintains accurate inventory records to meet customer needs. Distribution Center uses cycle counting to ensure their inventory records rately reﬂect what is stored in the warehouse and order fulﬁllment areas. counting is the process of verifying inventory accuracy by manually products in speciﬁc locations, comparing the counts to ELITE and differences. (
) ELITE reorder points alert NDC and other Distribution employees that inventory has fallen below speciﬁc quantities. A reorder point consists of range and quantity. (

) NDC Logistics Inventory Management Specialists establish a reorder all NDC products (with the exception of On Demand and TPDS), and them on a monthly or annual basis to avoid stock outages and back increased transportation costs, and potential work stoppages. (

) Specialty program customers place annual orders for products they will during the ﬁling season. The NDC ships groups of products to these as these orders and products are received. These shipments are called planned shipments. (
) Contractors ship some of these orders directly to the customer. These shipments are called contractor planned shipments. (
) The NDC ﬁlls public and internal orders for full cartons of published directly from the warehouse. Full carton orders are also called bulk (

) Specialty Programs are Distribution programs and products distributed to speciﬁc audience with special requirements. These programs include: • International Program • Tax Forms Outlets Program • Training Publication Distribution System • Internal Management Document Distribution System • Security Products • Prior Year Tax Products • Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) Program • Small Business Program • Package Assembly Program; including New Hire Kits • Quic
eact Letters • Supply items
Contractors ship some of these orders directly to the customer. These shipments are called contractor planned shipments.
The NDC ﬁlls public and internal orders for full cartons of published products directly from the warehouse. Full carton orders are also called bulk orders.
Specialty Programs are Distribution programs and products distributed to a speciﬁc audience with special requirements. These programs include:

International Program Tax Forms Outlets Program Training Publication Distribution System Internal Management Document Distribution System Security Products Prior Year Tax Products Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) Program Small Business Program Package Assembly Program; including New Hire Quic
eact Letters Supply items

) The International program supplies the American embassies, consulates, various military legal assistance offices worldwide with sufficient tax International meet the needs of Americans overseas. Each summer, International analysts email to these customers a survey listing the items and they used in the prior year. The customers place orders for the year and return them to a designated electronic forms mailbox. (

) The IRS distributes tax materials to outlets that are readily accessible to public. The NDC distributes some of the tax materials, and contractors Form Outlets the bulk of the orders. Most Program participants are libraries or post (TFOP) however, selected other organizations also distribute forms through the program. (
) Training Publication Distribution System (TPDS) provides training IRS operating divisions worldwide. Training instructors use over
Publication products in more than
courses. End users may be at IRS offices or System locations. Orders for training materials originate in the ﬁeld offices. (
) IRS employees use OSMS to order training material from the NDC. (

) The IMDDS program maintains IRS office mailing addresses and various published products to IRS audiences. The author(s) of the Management and the IMDDS coordinator identify the targeted audience(s), and Distribution automatic distribution quantities for each location. (IMDDS) (

) Some IRS published products contain protected information or are serially numbered. These security products require speciﬁc measures for Products storage, shipping, and disposal. Management authorizes and designates employees within certain order points to order security products. identiﬁes and authorizes which products a designated employee may (

) The NDC will enter and ﬁll orders only for current forms and publications ﬁve-year prior forms and instructions . The NDC may elect to use Year printing to ﬁll orders that extend beyond ﬁve prior years. (

) The VITA program uses an electronic ordering process. VITA program send order information electronically to CAPS for Stakeholder Income Tax Education, and Communications (SPEC) review and approval. following (VITA) approval, the analysts download the orders into ELITE for fulﬁllment. (

) The Small Business program is an established partnership with organizations to conduct Small Business Tax Workshops (SBTWs) on Business Program the IRS to provide resource materials for the stakeholder organizations’ and members. (
) The NDC assembles packages of printed products as a service to IRS employees only. Assembly Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.
Y
) Package Assembly Program requests include a list of cataloged products for use in workshops, conferences, trade shows, or one-time events. This also includes New Hire Kits for IRS employees. (
) The NDC receives data ﬁles and correspondence ﬁles from IRS organizations to create personalized letters for taxpayers and /or IRS employees. The NDC prints, folds, and ships the correspondence. (
) The NDC receives and ﬁlls IRS internal customer orders for supply items such as bubble mailers, boxes, and secure shipping supplies IRS offices order through OMS.
